dk.iha.plpa.multiparadigm

Class Schemer

  • java.lang.Object
    • dk.iha.plpa.multiparadigm.Schemer

  • public class Schemer
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all methods for calculations done in the Schemer graphing tool.
    Author:
    Tommy, Mikkel and Olafur

    • Constructor Detail

      • Schemer

        public Schemer()
        Constructor for Schemer class. Initializes the Scheme environment and registers functions used in various calculations. The functions are: (logB x B) - B is the base of the logarithm to apply to value x (log10func f) - returns a procedure that takes 10-base logarithm of function f (derivative f) - returns a procedure that is the approximation of the derivative of function f (rectangle a b N f) - returns an approximation of the integral of function f, using the rectangle method with N rectangles on the span from a to b

    • Method Detail

      • registerFunction

        public boolean registerFunction(java.lang.String functionExpression,
                       java.lang.String functionId)
        Registers a Scheme function in the current scheme environment for this instance of Schemer. Takes in a function id which is the name given to the function in the scheme environment.
        Parameters:
        functionExpression - String representation of the scheme function
        functionId - The id used for this function in the current Scheme environment.
        Returns:
        true if registration was successful else false.

      • getRectangleValues

        public double getRectangleValues(java.lang.String functionId,
                        double a,
                        double b,
                        int rectangles,
                        boolean derivative,
                        boolean logarithmic)
        Approximates an integral of functionId registered in the Scheme environment. Can return for the derivative using parameter derivative. Can return for logarithmic scales using parameter logarithmic.
        Parameters:
        functionId -
        a - The value we are calculating from
        b - The value we are calculating to.
        rectangles - No. of rectangles used in the calculation.
        derivative - Tells if we are calculating the area for a derivative function.
        logarithmic - Tells if we are using a logarithmic scale
        Returns:
        The result of the evaluation of the rectangle method for given function id.

      • getLogExtremes

        public double[] getLogExtremes(java.lang.Double ymin,
                      java.lang.Double ymax)
        Generates the extremes of the Y scale when using logarithmic scales.
        Parameters:
        ymin - Minimum values of Y
        ymax - Maximum values of Y
        Returns:
        Array of extremes of Y for logarithmic scale

      • evaluateFunction

        public double[] evaluateFunction(java.lang.String functionId,
                        java.lang.String functionExpression,
                        double[] xvalues,
                        boolean logarithmicScale)
        Evaluates a registered function with functionId in the current scheme environment, over the array x-values. Function expression is passed in for correct error reporting only.
        Parameters:
        functionId - The id of the registered scheme function
        functionExpression - String representation of the function.
        xvalues - Array of X values
        logarithmicScale - Boolean - if we are using the logarithmic scale or not.
        Returns:
        An array of evaluated values.

      • evaluateFunctionDerivative

        public double[] evaluateFunctionDerivative(java.lang.String functionId,
                                  double[] xvalues,
                                  boolean logarithmicScale)
        Evaluates the derivative of the registered function with functionId in the current scheme environment, over the array of xvalues.
        Parameters:
        functionId - The id of the registered scheme function
        xvalues - Array of X values
        logarithmicScale - Boolean - if we are using the logarithmic scale or not.
        Returns:
        an array of evaluated values.

      • generateXPoints

        public double[] generateXPoints(int datapoints,
                       java.lang.Double xmax,
                       java.lang.Double xmin)
        Generates an array of values ranging from xmin to xmax with the number of datapoints used to find the length of the interval between the points.
        Parameters:
        datapoints - Number of datapoints to calculate from
        xmax - Maximum X value
        xmin - Minimum X value
        Returns:
        An array of double values on the x number line.
